measure.CatchLine: Requires the Housing and Community Services Department to establish an eviction mediation program.
measure.MeasureSummary:
Digest: This Act requires OHCS to make a mediation program for all evictions. (Flesch Readability Score: 60.7). 
	Requires the Housing and Community Services Department to establish an eviction mediation program. Requires residential landlords to provide information about the program in termination notices. Requires parties to eviction to participate in the program. Amends eviction mediation and settlement procedures. Becomes operative on July 1, 2026. 
	Appropriates moneys to the department for the program. 
	Allows tenants to use nonattorneys in eviction proceedings and allows the prevailing party to recover nonattorney costs. 
	Takes effect on the 91st day following adjournment sine die.	.
measure.RelatingToFull: Relating to evictions; creating new provisions; amending ORS 90.255, 90.391, 105.113, 105.130, 105.135, 105.137, 105.145, 105.146, 105.148, 105.163 and 105.164; and prescribing an effective date.
measure.RelatingTo: Relating to evictions; prescribing an effective date.
measure.FiscalImpact: May have fiscal impact, but no statement yet issued
measure.RevenueImpact: May have revenue impact, but no statement yet issued

historyActions.ActionText: First reading. Referred to Speaker's desk.
Referred to Housing and Homelessness with subsequent referral to Ways and Means.
